qas.question: What is the typical amount of sunshine days in Tropical high pressure belt?
What feature cuts Namibia in half?
What is the winter in Namibia like?
When is the rainiest season in Namibia?
What is humidity like in Namibia?
How much rain fell during the summer of 2006/07?
How much rain typically falls in February each year in the Caprivi Strip?
What is the record amount of rain in the Caprivi Strip?
What is the record rainfall in the coastal desert?
What is the least amount of rainfall to ever fall in the Caprivi Strip in one year?

context: Typically the sub-Tropical High Pressure Belt, with frequent clear skies, provides more than <a0_0>300 days<a0_0/> of sunshine per year. It is situated at the southern edge of the tropics; <a1_0>the Tropic of Capricorn<a1_0/> cuts the country about in half. The winter (June – August) is generally <a2_0>dry<a2_0/>, both rainy seasons occur in summer, the small rainy season between September and November, the big one <a3_0>between February and April<a3_0/>. Humidity is <a4_0>low<a4_0/>, and average rainfall varies from almost <b9_0>zero<b9_0/> in the coastal desert to more than <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0>600 mm<b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> in the Caprivi Strip. Rainfall is however highly variable, and droughts are common. The last[update] bad rainy season with rainfall far below the annual average occurred in summer 2006/07.
